fu.util

Class IntervalSearchableList<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.util.IntervalSearchableList<T>

  • public class IntervalSearchableList<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    An interval-searchable list contains pairs of (value,object). We have the following differences to hashtables:
    • values are not IDs, i.e. they are not unique to identify an object.
    • searches are of the form: give me all objects with values in {from...to}.
    A typical scenario: consider a list of cities and their number of inhabitans. We then want to get all cities with inhabitions between 100000 and 150000. The implementation is based on binary search, thus an interval is retrieved in logarithmic time. For this, after adding all pairs (value,object), the list has to be sorted.

      • getIndexes

        public int[] getIndexes(long fromValue,
                        long toValue)
        Get the index range of list entries with values in the respective range (both borders included).
        Parameters:
        fromValue - range from
        toValue - range to
        Returns:
        array of 2, with [0]: first list index, [1]: last list index. May also be null for emtpy list.

      • getObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList<T> getObjects(long fromValue,
                                         long toValue)
        Get a sublist of objects (without their values) that have values in the respective interval. Returns an emtpy list (not null) for no hits.
        Parameters:
        fromValue - range from
        toValue - range to
        Returns:
        list of objects

      • getObjectsAndValues

        public java.util.ArrayList<LO<T>> getObjectsAndValues(long fromValue,
                                                      long toValue)
        Get a sublist of objects (with their values) that have values in the respective interval. Returns an emtpy list (not null) for no hits. The list is ordered (increasing) by the values.
        Parameters:
        fromValue - range from
        toValue - range to
        Returns:
        list of values and objects
